text:
San Francisco, CA

Sociable Labs is looking for a few more solid Java and JavaScript developers to help us build the field of social commerce.

We recently launched with a number of happy customers including ruelala.com, active.com, and backcountry.com. Our product is essentially a smarter version of Facebook's Social Plugins.

We're building a culture of analytics and testing with a focus on ROI. We're currently expanding our testing infrastructure with the ultimate goal being a continuous deployment production environment.

Our backed runs Java/Jetty and postgreSQL on Amazon EC2, our front-end is completely modularized JS that works with Facebook's SDK.

We aim for simple, understandable, testable code. We do a lot of code reviews and some occasional pair programming. The code reviews opt-in and generally given priority over anything that isn't urgent.

This is without a doubt one of the best environments I've ever worked in.

More information on http://www.sociablelabs.com/ and http://www.sociablelabs.com/Careers specifically.

I work on the front-end, but feel free to ask me about anything: nathan@[company site].com
